Why does the translation of the English word phrase "kneecaps" into Czech require a corpus of 50 million sentence pairs?
Why does translating the English word "kneecaps" into Czech require a corpus of 50 million sentence pairs, and what does this indicate about the challenges of rich morphology in translation models?

The translation model requires a corpus of 50 million sentence pairs to accurately produce the instrumental case of "Češky" in Czech, as this extensive dataset allows the model to learn the various forms and contexts needed for correct translation.
